definition: to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: He is now recovering in Los Angeles while Victoria is on a business trip in London.
sentences.chinese: 如今他在洛杉矶养伤，维多利亚则在伦敦出差。

sentences.english: While I was there, I took to reading the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 在医院养伤期间，我开始阅读圣经。

definition: to recuperate/to convalesce/to take care of one's health after illness
to get well/to heal/to recuperate/to convalesce/convalescence/to nurse
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
to close the passes/to seal off the country/seclusion (monastic practice, e.g. of Chan Buddhists)
to take care of (sb's health)/to nurse
